title: Can't run league of legends, cant uninstall league of legends.
body: I tried patching league of legends and it crashed and tried to revert to an older patch then the client.exe disappeared. I can't run the game. I tried uninstalling the game and deleting the folder and it just gives me error code: 0x80070570 corrupted and unreadable.

replies.body:
One of the things you can try to do is install League to any subdirectory not on that current partition (that hard drive since it seems to be an external). 

Try installing to C:/ if there's enough free space. If that works (and the install completes), just copy/paste (or cut/paste) the install onto your E into a new folder like 'League of Legendstest'. If it copies over, give it a whirl, see if that works.

From what limited view I can see on your pictures, your may have a corrupted file directory, which is why you can't do anything to that location. It might require a full format of your external hard drive to properly fix if you need that exact directory back. If it's completely unrecoverable and those sectors are unwriteable in general, your actual hard drive may have an error on that section of the platter.
https://imgur.com/a/A3ess This is what it looks like when I try to install it.
